title: PROC_Engager
author: PROC_Engager
content: Hello everyone,I've been thinking a lot about the impact of procrastination on our financial goals, especially when it comes to investing in Bitcoin. It's easy to put off making investments, thinking we'll do it later or when we have more money. But in reality, every day we delay is a missed opportunity for growth.I'm curious to hear your thoughts on this. How do you overcome procrastination when it comes to investing? What strategies do you use to stay motivated and take action now?Let's share our experiences and tips to help each other build a brighter financial future.Looking forward to your insights!

comments.author: Darker45
comments.body: I guess most procrastinate in Bitcoin investing not because they needed more time or money but because they want to enter at a pretty low price. The problem, however, is that by the time Bitcoin fell to their preferred price, fear gets the better of them. They end up setting a much lower buying price, oftentimes too low that Bitcoin can't anymore hit. In the end, they fail to buy. Then they look forward to another time, but then bull run comes. Many feel FOMO, ending up buying at a much higher price instead. The tip is just buy right away regardless of the price. And hodl. You will certainly be rewarded.

comments.author: Despairo
comments.body: As long as people have a lot money, they will think about investment.There's a difference when you have $5K in your bank and $50K in your bank, if you start when you have $5K, if it goes wrong, you have no safety net. But, if you have $50K, you can invest $40K and leave the rest for emergency funds.So how to overcome it? improve your skills, get better a job and saves your money first.

comments.author: Hatchy
comments.body: Quote from: Despairo on March 02, 2025, 05:42:44 AMAs long as people have a lot money, they will think about investment.There's a difference when you have $5K in your bank and $50K in your bank, if you start when you have $5K, if it goes wrong, you have no safety net. But, if you have $50K, you can invest $40K and leave the rest for emergency funds.So how to overcome it? improve your skills, get better a job and saves your money first.Yes, that sums it up. A wealthy dude ones said, the poor folks works to get their money. While the money works for the rich. For you to partake in any investment you must have a certain amount. No one would tell you though that you should. It's something that you personally should work on. Having just little money and risking it all on crypto investment would do you no good as you are going to likely sell off at the wrong time due to fear Or when an emergency comes up, you sell to settle off thing. FUD is something that you cannot totally eliminate as a trader because price would surly manipulate your decisions.

comments.author: X-ray
comments.body: Quote from: PROC_Engager on March 02, 2025, 03:10:19 AMI'm curious to hear your thoughts on this. How do you overcome procrastination when it comes to investing? What strategies do you use to stay motivated and take action now?make investing part of your financial planning, basically do DCA like everyone has been doing since long ago, most of them already making 200-300% profit of their saving by simply putting their money in bitcoin 1 year ago. it's definitely missed opportunity if you just procrastinating and holding off investing, because investing is an activity that requires time and time not used for investing is a time wasted.i'd say, allocate certain percent of your salary each month for buying bitcoin, consider it as an investment, or even better, just buy and forget, do it every month, literally what i've been doing right now.

comments.author: Iranus
comments.body: Quote from: Despairo on March 02, 2025, 05:42:44 AMAs long as people have a lot money, they will think about investment.There's a difference when you have $5K in your bank and $50K in your bank, if you start when you have $5K, if it goes wrong, you have no safety net. But, if you have $50K, you can invest $40K and leave the rest for emergency funds.So how to overcome it? improve your skills, get better a job and saves your money first.It is true that people with more money will be more comfortable and bold in investing, but that does not mean that people with less money will not think about investing. I think whether to invest or not does not depend entirely on capital but on each person's thinking and understanding. If poor people take the time to learn about investing and realize its potential, even with low income, their savings are small and life is still difficult. They will still find ways to invest because they know it is the only way to help them escape poverty. The key to overcoming procrastination is awareness, IMO.

comments.author: davis196
comments.body: Quote from: PROC_Engager on March 02, 2025, 03:10:19 AMHello everyone,I've been thinking a lot about the impact of procrastination on our financial goals, especially when it comes to investing in Bitcoin. It's easy to put off making investments, thinking we'll do it later or when we have more money. But in reality, every day we delay is a missed opportunity for growth.I'm curious to hear your thoughts on this. How do you overcome procrastination when it comes to investing? What strategies do you use to stay motivated and take action now?Let's share our experiences and tips to help each other build a brighter financial future.Looking forward to your insights!Most people would invest when there's a FOMO phase on the market(which means "fear of missing out"), the price is being pumped and the greed and optimism dominate. The same people would never invest in a bearish market, when the price is dropping. This is just a "sheep" mentality, when the people are just following the trend, without having any strategy or goals in mind. The "sheep" investors almost always end up losing their money. Procrastination or the "I'll do it later" attitude is a major problem not only for investing, but for you everyday life.I don't have a cure for procrastination. I also procrastinating a lot and it affects my life. I can tell you from personal experience that watching motivational videos on Youtube doesn't help at all.

comments.author: Die_empty
comments.body: Quote from: PROC_Engager on March 02, 2025, 03:10:19 AMHello everyone,I've been thinking a lot about the impact of procrastination on our financial goals, especially when it comes to investing in Bitcoin. It's easy to put off making investments, thinking we'll do it later or when we have more money. But in reality, every day we delay is a missed opportunity for growth.Procrastination is a thief of time and should be overcome totally. In investment timing is important and it is not the same in every asset. Like buying Bitcoin during the bear market is ideal and might give you profit during the bull run. Buying a real estate property in an area that is fast developing is better. QuoteI'm curious to hear your thoughts on this. How do you overcome procrastination when it comes to investing? What strategies do you use to stay motivated and take action now?Let's share our experiences and tips to help each other build a brighter financial future.Looking forward to your insights!I ensure that I don't keep fiat in my account for too long. If I have extra funds, I invest immediately and don't procrastinate. If I see a good land that is destress sale, I buy. If we are in the bear season when the price of Bitcoin is cheap, it will be good to buy if I have the money. No need to keep money that would have been invested for a long time because it would be eaten up by inflation.

comments.author: Patikno
comments.body: Delaying financial goals is bad for our future, especially if the thing that is being postponed is a golden opportunity to invest in Bitcoin. After learning from my experience, which also postponed investing in Bitcoin, I have often regretted it and finally got the answer to it. And after I realized, the thing that made me postpone investing in Bitcoin was because of the lack of understanding and the great potential that Bitcoin has, so that I underestimated it and postponed it with the excuse that I would start it when I had more money, when in fact what we postponed would actually make more money.So, in essence I only suggest studying Bitcoin fundamentally to know and realize its potential in the future, so that when the time comes, we will not regret the delay that was made, as you said.

comments.author: Frankolala
comments.body: To avoid procrastination, you need to start to invest into bitcoin right away if you have any little amount of money that's of no use to you. You don't need to be rich or have too much before you can invest into bitcoin. You can use as low as $5 to start your bitcoin investment, and continue buying regularly every week or month with that same amount in order to grow and build your bitcoin portfolio overtime.

comments.author: Queentoshi
comments.body: Quote from: PROC_Engager on March 02, 2025, 03:10:19 AMHow do you overcome procrastination when it comes to investing? What strategies do you use to stay motivated and take action now?Consider your future and what is at risk if you do not invest. There is barely any wealthy or person that has been able to make it without considering investing. If you keep procrastinating with every opportunity you have to invest, you are making it more difficult to become a successful individual. If you always have this thought at the back of your mind,  you will think twice each time you are about to procrastinating with investing.

comments.author: Mrbluntzy
comments.body: From time to time, procrastination has caused so many people more harm than good, not only in the aspects of investment but also in many other responsibilities that was supposed to be handled by the individual but they allowed their self to dance to the music of procrastination until it was too late to handle the challenge. Regarding the investment opportunities, many people have also learned a bad lesson from procrastination and we need to learn from and never allow such happen to us.

comments.author: alani123
comments.body: Would have been nice to have this thought a few years ago. We're at a turning point now because Bitcoin has gotten a lot of systemic recognition from banks, ETFs, funds and the lines. But even now this was priced in and the so called Trump effect may have started passing already. What is going to support crypto beyond this point? Could something even better happen? Not so easily. There could be a bear market that may set you years back in terms of investing. So procrastination or not, Bitcoin doesn't care

comments.author: Marvelockg
comments.body: Quote from: PROC_Engager on March 02, 2025, 03:10:19 AMI'm curious to hear your thoughts on this. How do you overcome procrastination when it comes to investing? What strategies do you use to stay motivated and take action now?the rule is as simple as ABC, just get started. you don't need to know everything and don't need to have a very perfect plan in place before getting started both in bitcoin investment and in any other form of investment. after you have started, you can then learn a lot of things along your investment journey and even if you make some mistakes that leads you to some losses, they will eventually help you become a better and a more experienced investor.instead of overthinking it and eventually procrastinating till you are unable to carry out your investment plan, it is better to start investing with a very small amount and along the line you can increase your invested amount based on the extent of knowledge you have acquire and in the long run you can buy a bulky BTC because you have set the basic things in place that will make you a better investor.procrastination tells you to do things at your comfort zone that never comes. just look at the market condition that went a bit bearish, some investors that are procrastinators would have missed out on good buying opportunity and will still miss out on some good buying opportunity because for the procrastinator, tomorrow is always the best time to buy and when that tomorrow eventually comes, another tomorrow becomes the best next time to buy till he finds another reason why today is not the best time to buy. as long as life is concern, if you don't want to pay the price today and do the needful now, it will only get more difficult tomorrow and if you can't do it today, your chance of doing it in the future will be even more slim.

comments.author: Synchronice
comments.body: Quote from: PROC_Engager on March 02, 2025, 03:10:19 AMHello everyone,I've been thinking a lot about the impact of procrastination on our financial goals, especially when it comes to investing in Bitcoin. It's easy to put off making investments, thinking we'll do it later or when we have more money. But in reality, every day we delay is a missed opportunity for growth.I'm curious to hear your thoughts on this. How do you overcome procrastination when it comes to investing? What strategies do you use to stay motivated and take action now?Let's share our experiences and tips to help each other build a brighter financial future.Looking forward to your insights!My motivation in investing is money. When I look at Bitcoin's price charts, starting from 2011, I see that this is the currency in which I have to invest because it's always going up. What gives me motivation also is that countries talk about creating Bitcoin strategic reserves. Bitcoin is still severely unadopted and it has a huge potential, I'm sure it will become a financial reserve like gold. So, I simply invest in Bitcoin and keep calm. Sadly, I bought some Bitcoins at $100K but it's okay for me, I bought some in 28 February at 80K. I feel fine because I know it will rise.

comments.author: tread93
comments.body: Quote from: PROC_Engager on March 02, 2025, 03:10:19 AMHello everyone,I've been thinking a lot about the impact of procrastination on our financial goals, especially when it comes to investing in Bitcoin. It's easy to put off making investments, thinking we'll do it later or when we have more money. But in reality, every day we delay is a missed opportunity for growth.I'm curious to hear your thoughts on this. How do you overcome procrastination when it comes to investing? What strategies do you use to stay motivated and take action now?Let's share our experiences and tips to help each other build a brighter financial future.Looking forward to your insights!Instead of only focusing on using your income to BUY bitcoin find out ways that you can EARN bitcoin. Sell things for bitcoin online or even through this forum. There are multiple auction type ebay like scarce city and things like this. Host a garage sale in your local currency and use the money to buy bitcoin. Buy a case of water and sell each individual for 1 dollar and repeat the process and use all proceeds to buy bitcoin. YOU HAVE NO EXCUSE. Only you can make it happen.

comments.author: Botnake
comments.body: Reality is, you will only be motivated to invest if you have sufficient amount of money. You create your investment plans and goals, and it is only by doing actual investment that you will achieve your goals in your investment. However, if you have lack of money to start your investment, your motivation as well will never grow. That’s probably one of the reasons why you end up procrastinating things because no matter what or how you’ll do it, once you have no money, investing will certainly become impossible.

comments.author: peter0425
comments.body: Quote from: PROC_Engager on March 02, 2025, 03:10:19 AMHello everyone,I've been thinking a lot about the impact of procrastination on our financial goals, especially when it comes to investing in Bitcoin. It's easy to put off making investments, thinking we'll do it later or when we have more money. But in reality, every day we delay is a missed opportunity for growth. Most of the time, people procrastinate or put off investing because either they are still waiting for the right price or still saving up more money.QuoteI'm curious to hear your thoughts on this. How do you overcome procrastination when it comes to investing? What strategies do you use to stay motivated and take action now?DCA helps the best. It allows you to regularly invest without overthinking it. It would help if you set your goals and focus so that you can plan accordingly.

comments.author: PrivacyG
comments.body: Quote from: PROC_Engager on March 02, 2025, 03:10:19 AMin reality, every day we delay is a missed opportunity for growth.This one is up for debate.You are only delaying an opportunity for growth IF that one choice you wanted to make actually ends up leading to growth.  Otherwise, it may end really badly.  Back when I started I remember I wanted to put a lot of money in Altcoins I thought would do amazingly well.  They all ended up dying and nobody cares about them any more.  What back then seemed like an incredible opportunity later became a pot of victims of a disaster.

comments.author: Pi-network314159
comments.body: Quote from: PROC_Engager on March 02, 2025, 03:10:19 AMI'm curious to hear your thoughts on this. How do you overcome procrastination when it comes to investing? What strategies do you use to stay motivated and take action now?Let's share our experiences and tips to help each other build a brighter financial future.!Although procrastination is an element of setback when it comes to investment. People often delay when it comes to investing because they simply think that there is still time, forgetting that time waits for no body. The easiest strategy to overcome procrastination is invest right away when we have the fund. Just like we have 3 different strategy which is lump sum, DCA and buying the dip. To be on a safer side we need to deploy the lump sum method if we can not be able to buy regular DCA or buying the dip.
